newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: ESTONIA'S HOIUPANK TO MOVE TO LITHANIAN MARKET - PAPER.
newsitem.headline: ESTONIA'S HOIUPANK TO MOVE TO LITHANIAN MARKET - PAPER.

text.p: Estonia' Hoiupank has decided to move into Lithuania's banking market, the business newspaper Verslo Zinios reported on Friday.

The newspaper quoted Hoiupank board member Aavo Kokk as saying that the bank had taken the decision to acquire a majority stake in one of three Lithuanian banks: Litimpeks, Ukio or the state-run Agricultural Bank.
Kokk told the newspaper that Hoiupank's strategic investor, the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), had approved the move and would also invest in the same Lithuanian bank.
The newspaper said Kokk added that Hoiupank Hoiupank will negotiate with the three banks at the same time and investigate their situation.
The newspaper said that if the Hoiupnak fails to reach an agreement with one of the banks by June, it will open a representative office in Lithuania.
Estonia's Hansapank became the first Baltic bank to move into a neighbouring market when it bought the German-Latvian Bank in Latvia.
Analysts say that Estonia is set to spearhead a pan-Baltic drive into the Lithuanian banking market, which is still recovering from a crisis sparked in late 1995.
